subject: Cooking
title: Jiro Ono: The Pursuit of Sushi Perfection
description: A 60-second lesson on Jiro Ono: The Pursuit of Sushi Perfection.

hook.text: A 10-seat basement restaurant in Tokyo earned 3 Michelin stars. The menu? Only sushi. 20 pieces. 30 minutes.

buildup.text: Jiro Ono, now in his 90s, has made sushi daily for over 70 years at Sukiyabashi Jiro.

discovery.text: His apprentices train for 10 years. They spend years just learning to cook rice before touching fish.

twist.text: The 2011 documentary 'Jiro Dreams of Sushi' turned him into a global icon â€” wait times hit months.

climax.text: His philosophy: 'Once you decide on your occupation, immerse yourself. Fall in love with your work.'

punchline.text: 70 years of doing one thing. That's not routine. That's mastery.

quiz.question: How long do Jiro Ono's apprentices train before they can prepare sushi for customers?
